title: Turmeric-Lime Aioli
description: A light, high-protein yogurt-based aioli with turmeric, lime, and garlic. Bright, earthy, and creamy with a citrus kick.
ingredients: 1 small garlic clove, finely grated or pressed
1 1/2 tbsp lime juice (≈1/2 lime or bottled)
1/4 tsp ground cumin or coriander (optional, for a Middle Eastern note)
instructions: In a small pan over low heat, warm the olive oil. Stir in turmeric and garlic for about 30 seconds, just until fragrant. Remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lime juice, maple syrup, Dijon, salt, and cumin or coriander if using.
Slowly whisk in the warm turmeric-garlic oil until smooth and evenly colored.
Taste and adjust seasoning: add a touch more lime for brightness or a few drops of maple syrup if it’s too tangy.
Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving to let flavors meld and the sauce thicken slightly.
notes: Serve cool over grilled chicken breast or shish taouk skewers. Excellent as a dip for sweet potatoes, a dressing for kale or arugula salads, or a spread for wraps. Keeps 4–5 days in the fridge. For extra creaminess, blend briefly with an immersion blender before chilling.
